header.author: Paul Mensonides
header.overview: The header defines macros used to selectively qualify unprefixed macro names.

macro.abstract: The macro is used to introduce a context that allows unprefixed macros to qualify themselves.
macro.para: This macro is used as a binding context on unprefixed macros that utilize .
This macro employs up to a nested binding depth of .

macro.abstract: The macro is used to define unprefixed names that are isolated from core language interference.

usage.param: The unprefixed name of a library primitive.

macro.para: This macro is used to define unprefixed variants of library primitives that are incapable of interferring with the core language.

Normal usage consists of starting with a prefixed name and defining an object-like macro of the form:
#define id (id)
For example,
#define STRINGIZE (STRINGIZE)
This defines an object-like macro that expands to if (and only if) it is expanded in a context introduced by . Otherwise, it expands to plain STRINGIZE.
This effectively renders unprefixed macro names from conflicting with anything but other unprefixed macro names.

macro.abstract: The macro is used to bypass the context introduced via .

usage.param: The unprefixed name of a library primitive.

macro.para: This macro is used to override the context introduced via .
